comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: Although the two ground personnel are blocking the view of the rear fuselage of this aircraft, it is almost certainly the Jasta 18 D.VII that was obtained and test flown by the Americans in the immediate postwar period. The front radiator shell and underneath area of the nose are painted white, while the rest of the nose and wings are painted the vermillion red of Jasta 18. The white rear fuselage is also a trademark of Jasta 18. The cooling cutout just behind the radiator was a common feature no the series of aircraft assigned to Jasta 18.
